attrByVar
Returns the value of an instance attribute of a given type via a variable declared earlier using
var
.
Syntax
The syntax of the function depends on the choice of function signs.
variable.attr
variable.setAttr (attr, value)
variable.setAttr (attr, value, date)
Sign
Purpose
Set  value
Defines the assignment of a value to the selected attribute. That is, by means of this function the transformation of the used attribute values is performed. The
save
function must be used to save the transformations.
Specify attribute type
Determines how to handle attributes of the
child object type
. The sign is active after selecting a parent object attribute, similar to the
attr
function.
Setting
Purpose
variable
The variable with attribute-collection value, previously declared in the current algorithm via the
var
function.
attr
The attribute of the selected variable.
value
The value assigned to the attribute.
When the function is called, a dummy variable
"null"
is set, which should be replaced with the required value.
date
The date for which the value is assigned. The parameter applies to
historical-attribute
.
When the function is called, a dummy variable
"currentDate()"
is set, which should be replaced with the required value.
The value is assigned within the given period of dynamics (
field "Discreteness of time dependence"
).
If the
historical-attribute
dynamics period is not set, the data is fixed until the next value is entered.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Algorithms" tab.
After that a modal window opens where it is necessary to select the variable and then the attribute whose value should be returned.
If it is necessary to select a function sign, check the corresponding checkbox.
The attribute selection is limited to the object type of the declared variable (that is, attributes of the object type previously declared via the
var
function in the current algorithm are available).
Examples
Example 1
Create a "Guarantee" object with the following attribute values:
number of days for property insurance - 100;
currency of the sum insured - USD.
The
attrByVar
function is used to set attribute values. It is selected for each attribute with the "Set Value" sign:
The number of days for insurance is specified manually;
The currency of the amount to be covered is determined by the
dict
function (selecting the Systemâ€™s directory value).
Other functions were also used to write this algorithm.
More details
The new variable is defined using the
var
function.
The
newInstance
function is used to create a new profile of the "Guarantee" object type.
The
save
function must be used to save the changes in the created instance.
